document.ModsDocTitle: The Australian Lynx Spiders (Araneae, Oxyopidae, Oxyopes) of the Godeffroy Collection, including the description of a new species
document.docAuthor: Baehr, Barbara C., Harms, Danilo, Duperre, Nadine & Raven, Robert
document.masterDocTitle: The Australian Lynx Spiders (Araneae, Oxyopidae, Oxyopes) of the Godeffroy Collection, including the description of a new species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The Australian Lynx Spiders (Araneae, Oxyopidae, Oxyopes) of the Godeffroy Collection, including the description of a new species

subSubSection.paragraph: Oxyopes gratus L. Koch, 1878 Figs 9 A-E , 20F
573. Oxyopes gratus L. Koch, 1878, 1006-1008, Taf. 88 Fig. 3 + 3 a und 4-4 b, Australien, Peak Downs, 2 Syntypen (Mus. GODEFFROY Nr. 16495) (37) ( Rack 1961 ).

Designated here: FEMALE LECTOTYPE (ZMH-A0000009), from Queensland, Peak Downs, "now large open cut coking coal mine in Queensland located 31 km SSE of Moranbah",
22°15 '9.60" S
,
148°10 '30.00" E
, Godeffroy Collection; (ZMH-A0000030) 1 female paralectotype, same as lectotype, Godeffroy Collection.

The female of Oxyopes gratus is similar to Oxyopes variabilis in having a T-shaped scapus with T arms shorter than lateral lobes but can be separated from Oxyopes variabilis by having copulatory ducts with only 2 coils (Figs 9E, 20F). Male unknown.

caption.paragraph: Figure 9. Oxyopes gratus L. Koch, 1878, female lectotype (ZMH- A0000009): A, habitus, dorsal view; B, habitus, ventral view; C, epigyne, ventral view; D, epigyne, ventral view, cleared; E, epigyne, dorsal view, cleared. Scale bars: habitus 1.0 mm, epigyne 0.1 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph: Original record from Peak Downs in northern Queensland. The ALA lists additional records from Queensland, Victoria, the Northern Territory, and the Goldfields in Western Australia.
Remarks. Koch mentions that the specimens were collected by Daemel who observed the species on leaves.
